subject: Web3
title: Hybrid Stablecoins
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Hybrid Stablecoins.

hook.text: What if you combined multiple approaches? Hybrid stablecoins use both reserves and algorithms for extra safety.

buildup.text: Frax pioneered this model: partially backed by real assets and partially stabilized by an algorithm.

discovery.text: The hybrid approach aims for the best of both worlds â€” capital efficiency of algorithms plus the security of reserves.

twist.text: After Terra's collapse, even Frax moved toward full collateral backing. The market lost faith in pure algorithms.

climax.text: Hybrids show that stablecoin design is still evolving. The ideal balance between efficiency and safety isn't settled.

punchline.text: Half algorithm, half reserves. After Terra, the reserves won the argument.

quiz.question: What is a hybrid stablecoin?
options: A stablecoin pegged to two currencies
One that combines reserve backing with algorithmic mechanisms
